metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5967 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The time subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.9.9, whenCONFIG_TIMER_STATS is enabled, allows local users to discover real PIDvalues (as distinguished from PID values inside a PID namespace) by readingthe /proc/timer_list file, related to the print_timer function inkernel/time/timer_list.c and the __timer_stats_timer_set_start_infofunction in kernel/time/timer.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1150.161
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1154-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1154.164
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
